snippet: California lawmakers passed a bill on Wednesday that will force the state’s public employee pension funds to drop investments in coal.
abstract: California State Assembly passes bill forcing the state's public employee pension funds to discard investments in coal; bill's sponsor, Senate president pro tempore Kevin de Leon, notes coal industry stocks not only hurt the environment but are losing value; bill will go to Gov Jerry Brown for consideration.
lead_paragraph: California lawmakers passed a bill on Wednesday that will force the state’s public employee pension funds to drop investments in coal.

headline.main: California: Coal Dropped From Public Pension Funds
headline.print_headline: California: Coal Dropped From Public Pension Funds
